metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12464 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
usb_sg_cancel in drivers/usb/core/message.c in the Linux kernel before 5.6.8 has a use-after-free because a transfer occurs without a reference, aka CID-056ad39ee925. It was discovered that the USB susbsystem's scatter-gather implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly take data references in some situations, leading to a use-after-free. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-184-generic - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-4.4.0-184-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-4.4.0-184-lowlatency - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-184-generic - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-184-lowlatency - 4.4.0-184.214
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-184.214').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1109.120').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1073.77~16.04.1').
